Sentencas: Co-electrolysis of H2O and CO2 in a solid oxide electrolysis cell (SOEC) is promising for simultaneous energy storage and CO2 utilization.
Titulo: Modeling of CH4-assisted SOEC for H2O/CO2 co-electrolysis

Sentencas: Fuel-assisted H2O electrolysis by SOEC (SOFEC) has been demonstrated to be effective in reducing power consumption.
Titulo: Modeling of CH4-assisted SOEC for H2O/CO2 co-electrolysis

Sentencas: In this paper, the effects of fuel (i.e. CH4) assisting on CO2/H2O co-electrolysis are numerically studied using a 2D model.
Titulo: Modeling of CH4-assisted SOEC for H2O/CO2 co-electrolysis

Sentencas: The model is validated with the experimental data for CO2/H2O co-electrolysis.
Titulo: Modeling of CH4-assisted SOEC for H2O/CO2 co-electrolysis

Sentencas: One important finding is that the CH4 assisting is effective in lowering the equilibrium potential of SOEC thus greatly reduces the electrical power consumption for H2O/CO2 co-electrolysis.
Titulo: Modeling of CH4-assisted SOEC for H2O/CO2 co-electrolysis

Sentencas: The performance of CH4-assisted SOFEC increases substantially with increasing temperature, due to increased reaction kinetics of electrochemical reactions and CH4 reforming reaction.
Titulo: Modeling of CH4-assisted SOEC for H2O/CO2 co-electrolysis

Sentencas: The CH4-assisted SOFEC can generate electrical power and syngas simultaneously at a low current density of less than 600 Am-2 and at 1123 K.
Titulo: Modeling of CH4-assisted SOEC for H2O/CO2 co-electrolysis

Sentencas: In addition, different from conventional SOEC, whose performance weakly depends on the anode gas flow rate, the CH4-assisted SOFEC performance is sensitive to the anode gas flow rate (i.g. peak current density is achieved at an anode flow rate of 70 SCCM at 1073 K).
Titulo: Modeling of CH4-assisted SOEC for H2O/CO2 co-electrolysis

Sentencas: The model can be used for subsequent design optimization of SOFEC to achieve high performance energy storage.
Titulo: Modeling of CH4-assisted SOEC for H2O/CO2 co-electrolysis
